intro: Huberia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Huberia peruviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and full sun.
